original_title: Sri Lanka inks deal with Sinopec to distribute fuel
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has signed a long-term contract with China’s Sinopec group to be a petroleum distributor in the island, the President’s media office said.
Sinopec Fuel Oil Lanka (Pvt) Ltd will be allowed to import, store, distribute and sell petroleum products in the island.
In the first year the company has to import fuel without depending on the domestic banking system, the statement said.
The agreement was signed before President Ranil Wickremesinghe by M P U K Mapa Pathirana, Secretary of the Ministry of Energy and Chen Chengmin, head of Sinopec’s production and marketing department.
Sinopec is expected to begin operations within 45 days of being given as license, the statement said. (Colombo/May22/2023)
